intro: Tithymalus aellenii, commonly known as the Aellen's tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant features daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Tithymalus aellenii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
